title: Grizzly - Joel Wilshere
description: Joel Wilshere sticks an assorted array of heavy flips and tech tricks for his Grizzly part – concluding with a wild combo ender! Additional filming by Andrew Maude, Clinton Davison and Indi Russell.

title: TUANY
description: Skate video filmed during three months backpacking from Mexico to Costa Rica, crossing Guatemala, El Salvador, Honduras and Nicaragua. Locations: Oaxaca, Mexico; Huatulco, Mexico; Campeche, Mexico; Palenque, Mexico; Flores, Guatemala; Leon, Nicaragua. Filmers: Juan Rodriguez, Christian Rodriguez, Elie Ressot, Walter Gonzalez, Sebastien Cao, Theo Meas.

title: Happily Ever After
description:
-- English subtitles are availables --
"This story begins some years ago, in a small town in northeast Italy called Udine, and follows the adventures of some of my friends and our passion for skateboarding.
We have traveled a lot, around Friuli Venezia Giulia and in the nearby regions, for filming this project.
'Happily Ever After' is my first independent full length skateboarding movie."
Words by Luca Poldelmengo.
Backstage photo and extra footage: http://skate-happily-ever-after.tumblr.com
Still frames: http://flickr.com/photos/lucapoldelmengo/sets/72157657948849510

title: Sign Of The Times
description: From the back of the VHS sleeve: During the 2001-02 year TNP traveled across the US filming Skate, Snow, and Surf footage. "Sign of the Times" features: riders of all ages, flash animations, and new music from Lidix, SBI, Sick Mediks, FAT LUV, D-Tao, and Chase Lott. Inside you will see Skylar Petty heel flip indy 10 stairs, 14 year old Zack Owen throwing down big BS rodeos, epic pow lines by Dan Seyferth, Lincoln Ueda boosting at ASR 2002, Ryan Wilburn stomp a BS 360 nose grab @ Newburg, guest appearances by Kareem Campbell and the Stone Temple Pilots @ Street Scene. Shot on location in Oregon, Washington, Idaho, California, Virginia, and Hawaii. Artwork by Rick Sweem.

title: Thunder X Chrystie NYC - Loose Bolts
description: A cinematic cruise through NYC turns into a Euro rip with Aaron Herrington and Maxi Schaible. Billy McFeely’s synth jams add the good vibes

description: Transworld Video #3. A montage-style video of epic proportions. Packed full of the best skateboarders in the world. Fast-paced action from start to finish. Definitely our best video yet. What are you waiting for? Get this thing to a VCR quick!

title: Transworld - Are You Alright?
description: Transworld Video #15. Are You Alright? is not a tour video or a documentary - it's an adventurous journey that takes you through the peaks and valleys of skateboarding life on the road. With no hotels, demos, autograph signings, or responsibilities, eleven skateboarders spontaneously set out in a 36-foot R.V. to enjoy the Northwestern terrain and all it has to offer. What they found was that the R.V. not only served as transportation, but as a home, a shower, a restaurant, a party, and the centerpiece of our story. So pull out that ol' sleeping bag and get ready for an urban R.V.ing experience you won't soon forget. Are You Alright? follows Jon Holland and Jason Hernandez around on an RV tour through the Northwest while hitting parks and spots along the way. Also featured is a cast of other skaters, including Danger, who took a legendary slam dropping in on the Garfield High School banks.

title: Transworld - A Time To Shine
description: Transworld Video #18. A Time To Shine opens with a part from Cooper Wilt. Chris Roberts’ part is full of unmatched balance. Ronson Lambert finishes his ridiculously technical part with a frontside bigspin front blunt kickflip out. Chad Tim Tim’s part is pure class with exemplary execution…

title: Transworld - Not Another Transworld Video
description: Transworld Video #23. The first skate video filmed entirely in HD, Not Another TransWorld Video showcased the smooth ledge-tech wizardry of Shane O’Neill and his near-impossible switch flip backside tailslide backside 270 switchflip out, had Theotis Beasley going hard in the paint, showed off the quirky stylings of Mike Anderson and Nestor Judkins, and further documented the laid-back Tom Penny-esque nonchalance of Wes Kremer.

title: Transworld - Sight Unseen
description: Transworld Video #12. Sight Unseen remains a veritable how-to when it comes to crafting a proper skate video: from John Cardiel setting the template for all-terrain skating to Tosh Townend’s break-out part, the frenzy of Dustin Dollin to Heath Kirchart’s timeless skating paired with “Nights In White Satin.” Top it all off with Henry Sanchez crawling out from retirement to give his final one-two punch to skateboarding.

title: kg.
description:
"New Hopps pick-up, Kyler Garrison — who you might remember going perpendicular down D7 on two wheels in the Hopps x Labor edit — has a new part out for Emage Skateshop. Starting in Denver, stopping over in Chicago, and rounding out the final half in New York, it’s one of those parts that just gets better as the minutes progress.
Everybody can run through the list of the famous spots here or any city, but this one especially feels like it has a focus on cuttier mid-route landmarks where the tricklist is less tangible: the chained marble circle between Labor and Hawa Juices, the Max Palmer Fountain, or those two eggs by BAM that we always notice the marks on, but wonder what people have actually pulled off on them. Edited and filmed by Colton Abernathy in a gritty hue of VX that’s reminiscent of the first parts we ever saw from Cyrus and Max." -Quartersnacks
